title.narrative: Providing emergency reproductive health services and follow-up to pregnant women and girls in Yemen.

description.narrative: 1- Reducing infant mortality and pregnant women, as the mortality of pregnant women in Yemen is a great challenge and is considered one of the highest in the world 2- Expanding the geographical area of ​​health and reproductive services, and intervening in the poorest and needy regions (West Coast) 3- Supporting the resilience of the health sector by supporting hospitals with diagnostic devices and equipment for operating rooms, and the emergency department 4- Raising the efficiency of workers in the health sector by training health midwives to provide emergency reproductive services in light of the lack of qualified health personnel such as doctors and specialists, gynecologists and obstetricians. 5- Providing the necessary medicines and medical equipment to provide the necessary health service in cases of rape, which helps prevent the spread of sexually transmitted diseases. 6- Raising community awareness, spreading health education among the population, and fighting the culture of giving birth to pregnant women at home, which is one of the most important causes of death for infants and pregnant women.

Providing reproductive health services, monitoring pregnancy, treating some pathological complications that arise during pregnancy, and providing cesarean delivery services in necessary cases. By supporting 15 reproductive health centers, including 6 specialized centers containing operating rooms in which Caesarea sections are performed and others, in addition to 9 reproductive health centers concerned with monitoring pregnancy and the health of the mother and the child.
